author: Staff Reporter
text:
Staff of the Forest Department seized around 2 tonnes of red sanders logs from a canal at Thiruparuthikundram in Kancheepuram on Tuesday.

Staff on duty at the District Forest Office received a tip-off that the logs were buried in the canal bed near a poultry farm at Thiruparuthikundram.

Subsequently, a team of officials visited the spot and after an extensive search, seized 47 logs, reported to be from 15-year-old trees.

Buried a year ago

Stating that the value of the seized timber was around Rs.10 lakh, officials said the logs might have been buried in the canal bed a year ago, as the colour of the wood had changed.
title: Rs. 10 lakh worth red sanders logs seized
